newsitem.title: USA: API says U.S. crude stocks fell in week.
newsitem.headline: API says U.S. crude stocks fell in week.

text.p: U.S. crude oil stocks held in primary storage fell 9.71 million barrels in the week ended July 25 to 308.94 million barrels from 318.65 million barrels the previous week, the American Petroleum Institute said Tuesday.
API said that crude stocks excluding PADD 5 (Petroleum Administration for Defense District) fell 7.25 million barrels in the week to 249.17 million barrels.
Distillate stocks fell 835,000 barrels to 119.31 million barrels from 120.14 million barrels the prior week.
API said PADD 1 distillate stocks rose 1.14 million barrels to 46.52 million barrels.
It said gasoline production fell 143,000 barrels per day in the week to 7.88 million bpd from 8.02 million bpd in the prior week.
Gasoline stocks fell 3.17 million barrels in the week to 194.63 million barrels from 197.80 million.
Percent of stocks capacity fell to 96.1 percent from 96.7 percent the prior week.
API said reformulated gasoline stocks (RFG) fell 3.69 million barrels to 37.31 million barrels from 41.00 million barrels the previous week.
API also said refinery operating rate excluding PADD 5 rose to 101.1 percent in the week from 100.2 percent the previous week.
API said crude runs to processing units fell to 14.83 million barrels per day from 14.92 million the previous week.
Residual fuel stocks in the latest week fell to 36.95 million barrels from 37.26 million in the previous week.
Crude oil imports fell to 8.14 million barrels per day from 8.15 million, API said.
